revised_title: Papers Read to the Society: June 17, 1897
tldr: This article discusses the importance of studying the nature and causes of variation in species, focusing on two methods of investigation: selecting obvious variations and analyzing their potential role in species derivation, and using statistical methods to study the condition of organs in a population. The author highlights the potential of the latter method to provide more accurate insights into the causes of variation and its role in the origin of species. The article also presents various research papers read to the Royal Society during the session.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
